description:
Implement PPB_NetworkMonitor_Private Pepper interface.

The P2PSocketDispatcher::NetworkListObserver has been moved 
to webkit_glue:: namespace in webkit/glue/network_list_observer.h . PPB_NetworkMonitor_Private_Impl uses P2PSocketDispatcher to get 
notifications about network changes.

BUG=114808


Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=125761

Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=126274

messages.text:
A test that gets some more coverage of NetworkList (and its C++ wrapper) would be helpful.

http://codereview.chromium.org/9557006/diff/3001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc

http://codereview.chromium.org/9557006/diff/3001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode18

http://codereview.chromium.org/9557006/diff/3001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode25
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:25: PP_Resource list_resource;

ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:29: CallbackData* data = reinterpret_cast<CallbackData*>(user_data);
nit: static_cast

http://codereview.chromium.org/9557006/diff/3001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode35
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:35: pp::Module::Get()->core()->ReleaseResource(network_list);
Can you explain what's going on? You're saving the first network_list, but only the first?

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc
File ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode17
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:17: #define ASSERT_SUCCESS(error_message) \
Please comment to explain what "SUCCESS" means here (empty string) and/or what you're using this for (calling a separate method that follows the PPAPI test convention of returning a non-empty string on error). I almost suggested a name like "ASSERT_STRING_NONEMPTY", but after seeing ASSERT_SUCCESS in context, I understand why you chose this name.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode19
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:19: return (error_message);
Maybe worth putting in a "do {...} while (false)" to
(a) force consistent use of a semi-colon and
(b) disallow weird constructs like:
  if (p)
    ASSERT_SUCCESS(foo);
  else
    DoSomethingElse();
In this case, the else would actually apply to the "if (!(error_message).empty())" in your macro.

Alternatively, you could get rid of the macro...  it doesn't save that much code or greatly improve readability.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode73
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:73: // Verify that there is at least one interface
nit: might be clearer to say "network interface" or something, to distinguish from PPAPI interfaces.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode77
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:77: // Iterate over all interface and verify their properties.
nit: interface->interfaces

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode79
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:79: 
style nit: extra carriage return

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode93
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:93: ASSERT_TRUE(j != addresses[i].size);
A quick comment above this loop saying "Make sure the address is non-zero" or whatever might be nice.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode98
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:98: ASSERT_TRUE(!network_list.GetDisplayName(iface).empty());
why not use ASSERT_FALSE?

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc#newcode130
ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc:130: pos != reinterpret_cast<char*>(&*addresses.end()); ++pos) {
I think dereferencing end() is technically undefined (though it should be fine in practice), so it might be better to do something like:
reinterpret_cast<char*>(&addresses[0] + addresses.size())

http://codereview.chromium.org/9557006/diff/7001/ppapi/tests/test_network_monitor_private.cc

> convention of returning a non-empty string on error). I almost suggested a name
> like "ASSERT_STRING_NONEMPTY", but after seeing ASSERT_SUCCESS in context, I
> understand why you chose this name.

That was actually copied from the TCPServerSocket tests. There is also RUN_SUBTEST() in test_transport.cc that is almost the same as this one. Maybe we should just move this macro to test_case.h? When I wrote test_transport.cc I initially put RUN_SUBTEST() there, but then Brett advised against it because that was the only test that needed that macro.

> In this case, the else would actually apply to the "if

> Alternatively, you could get rid of the macro...  it doesn't save that much code

Done, but see my comment about RUN_SUBTEST() above.

Sure, we can do that since there are several uses. The tricky part will be coming up with the right name. Maybe "ASSERT_SUBTEST_SUCCESS" would be descriptive & short enough?

I think it makes sense to put that in to test_case.h in a separate CL, though.

Uploaded the new patchset now. Sorry.
